column2: Police say 170 arrested in deadly biker gang shootout at Texas restaurant
column3:
Police in Waco, Tex., said Monday they had arrested 170 people after a shootout involving multiple biker gangs at a restaurant that left at least nine people dead.

While investigators worked to piece together precisely what happened on Sunday, authorities said they remained alert after receiving threats of possible retaliation against police officers after the chaotic brawl.

The sea of people arrested were charged with engaging in organized criminal activity, which is a capital murder charge due to the number of victims, Sgt. W. Patrick Swanton, a Waco police spokesman, said at a news conference Monday.

“There was a significant danger here yesterday because of the amount of violence that occurred behind us here,” Swanton said while standing in front of the restaurant.

The spasm of deadly violence began when members of biker gangs began fighting inside the restroom of Twin Peaks, a restaurant in a retail strip on Interstate 35 known to locals as a biker bar. In addition to firearms, the fighting involved fists, feet, knives and chains, officials said.

Swanton said that gunfire began inside the restaurant before spilled out onto the patio bar area and then into the parking lot. Several shooting victims were found near the front of the restaurant or in the parking lot around it, he said.

“We had wounded inside, we had people stabbed, we had people shot and we had people beat,” Swanton said.

There were already 18 police officers and another four officers from the state Department of Public Safety in the parking lot because officials had received information about the danger posed by these gangs being in the same place, Swanton said. Once outside, the bikers turned their gunfire on the police officers who responded, he said.

“Those officers’ reactions…to a very hostile, deadly situation saved our citizens’ lives yesterday afternoon,” Swanton said.

After the fighting, authorities said that nine people had been killed, and remarkably no police officers or other bystanders in the area had been injured.

The 170 people taken into custody were initially taken to the city’s convention center for processing before being brought to the McLennan County Jail, which was still working to process all of these individuals on Monday.

Police originally said 192 people were arrested, but Swanton revised that number on Monday and said it was possible the number could still change as they continued to sift through all of the names.

The jail, located about 15 minutes away from the retail strip where the shootings occurred, was still working Monday morning to process all of the people who had been arrested, an official said.

Authorities continued to investigate the area around the Twin Peaks restaurant on Monday. More than 100 motorcycles and dozens of other vehicles remained in the parking lot.

“We’re not in a rush,” Swanton said. “This is obviously a very large investigation involving numerous agencies and organizations, and we’re going to get it right.”

[Police: Restaurant has some answering to do]

Swanton said police have received information about “payback” against officers and reports of bikers flooding into the area after the shooting. As a result, he said officers have been stationed around the region to watch for any threat.

“There was a green light put out on law enforcement is our understanding from last night,” he said Monday. “We’re aware of that threat, and we have the appropriate response if we have to face that.”

The brawl occurred on Sunday at noon at the sports bar, with violence erupting and sending terrified patrons diving for cover in a busy Central Texas shopping center.

Swanton was critical of the restaurant, saying after the shootout that its management has “not been of much assistance to us.”

It was typical to see motorcycles parked outside of Twin Peaks, said Saul Cornejo Bravo, 19, a server at a Mexican restaurant next door.

“But not that many, especially on a Sunday afternoon,” he said. “Usually I see them there later at night.”

Bravo said that he was working on Sunday when the shooting occurred, and within seconds he saw emergency vehicles flooding the parking lot.

He saw one man wearing a biker’s vest who appeared to have been shot in the stomach. Paramedics tried to perform CPR for several minutes, Bravo said. “Then they just covered him up,” he said.

Off-duty police officers shopping in the retail strip rushed to the scene despite lacking any protective gear, Swanton said. Meanwhile, some of the people who ran away from Twin Peaks as the chaos unfolded took shelter behind an empty building.

“We sat there gathering our wits,” said J.R., who works at Cabela’s Outpost, an outdoors store across the parking lot from Twin Peaks. “At first you think it’s like a carjacking or something. But then, with all the shots and people running you realize it’s something more serious.”

Police said in a statement Monday said the Twin Peaks restaurant and parking lot were “still a very active crime scene” — one that “is littered with bullets, blood and other evidence. Civilian as well as Police units with bullet holes remain to be processed.” Parts of Central Texas Market Place, where the Twin Peaks sports bar is located, were expected to remain closed for the day, police said.

Five known gangs were believed to be involved in the brawl, Swanton said, but he would not identify them on Monday.

“I am not about to give them the respect of mentioning their names…. We don’t care what their names are, and we’re not going to give them publicity,” he said.

Swanton said it was still not clear how many shots were fired by gang members or police. It was unclear whether any of the nine bikers killed in the fight were shot by police.

“It was chaos,” said J.R., who declined to give his last name. “People were screaming and going crazy. Most of it seemed to be in the parking lot, and it was over very quickly.”

All of the people charged with organized crime activity will face a capital murder charge, Swanton said, due to the number of people killed Sunday. Texas state law says that a person who murders more than one other person “during the same criminal transaction” can face this charge, while  suspects can be charged with organized criminal activity if they carry out a murder or capital murder as part of a criminal street gang.

Eighteen people were taken to hospitals after the brawl with injuries that included stab and gunshot wounds, Swanton said. Some victims were being treated for both, he told reporters in Central Texas on Sunday.

“I was amazed that we didn’t have innocent civilians killed or injured,” Swanton said, according to the Associated Press, which noted:

McLennan County Sheriff Parnell McNamara said all nine who were killed were members of the Bandidos or Cossacks gangs, according to the AP.

A threat assessment released last year by the Texas Department of Public Safety classified the Bandidos gang in the second-highest tier threat. The Department of Justice lists the Bandidos as one of the handful of organized motorcycle gangs that “pose a serious national domestic threat.”

[How the Bandidos became one of the world’s most feared biker gangs]

For some in the region, they could sense rising friction between the different motorcycle gangs when members were at the same bars and restaurants.

“There were these little tiffs going on, and then you add alcohol,” said Richard, a motorcycle enthusiast who also declined to give his last name. “I just felt like there was tension.”

He said biker had activity had increased in and around Waco in the last few years, probably because of its proximity to both the Dallas-Fort Worth area and Austin.

“Ninety nine percent of of the people who ride bikes are good people, doctors, lawyer, engineers,” said Richard, an engineer. “It’s the one percent that don’t care about anything. They say, ‘We’ll do what we do.’ It was a rude awakening for the rest of us. Is this going to land on our doorsteps? Is this what we have to look forward to? What happens if we’re wearing the wrong shirt in the wrong neighborhood? That’s what has a lot of us worried.”

On Sunday, witnesses described seeing a mass shootout that involved dozens of of guns being fired inside the restaurant and in the parking lot along Interstate 35, according to CBS affiliate KWTX. The station reported that panicked patrons and employees sought refuge from the mayhem in the restaurant freezer.

Hours later, authorities from multiple law enforcement agencies — including local and state police, and the federal Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives — were still trying to secure the area and survey the large crime scene, which was littered with more than 100 weapons.

“In 34 years of law enforcement, this is the most violent crime scene I have ever been involved in,” Swanton said, according to the Waco Tribune-Herald. “There is blood everywhere. We will probably approach the number of 100 weapons.”

Swanton called it “one of the worst gun fights we’ve ever had in the city limits. They started shooting at our officers.”

The officers returned fire, Swanton said, and some armed bikers were shot by police. Swanton defended the officers’ actions and said they prevented more deaths.

“Their action has saved lives in keeping this from spilling into a very busy Sunday morning,” he said, according to CNN. “Thank goodness the officers were here, and took the action that they needed to take to save numerous lives.”

Authorities said it was not immediately clear what precisely triggered the violence, but the potential for conflict did not surprise the Twin Peaks staff or officers. McLennan County District Attorney Abel Reyna told the AP that tensions between the gangs had been building for months.

Police were bracing for violence: Swanton said Waco police officers and state officers were at the sports bar when the fighting began and that they had secured the area because they “expected issues.” He said the restaurant’s management requested the officers in anticipation of trouble.

“We have been made aware in the last few months of rival biker gangs — rival criminal biker gangs — being here and causing issues,” Swanton said. “We have attempted to work with the local management of Twin Peaks to get that cut back, to no avail. They have not been of much assistance to us.”

Jay Patel, operating partner for the Twin Peaks franchise in Waco, said in a statement Sunday: “We are horrified by the criminal, violent acts that occurred outside of our Waco restaurant today. We share in the community’s trauma. Our priority is to provide a safe and enjoyable environment for our customers and employees, and we consider the police our partners in doing so.”

Patel added that “our management team has had ongoing and positive communications with the police and … we will continue to cooperate with the police as they investigate this terrible crime.”

Swanton called Patel’s statement a “fabrication,” according to the AP, which reported that the Waco police “described the management as uncooperative with authorities in addressing concerns about the gangs.”

“Are we frustrated? Sure,” Swanton said, according to CNN. “Because we feel like there may have been more that could have been done by a business to prevent this.”

Police said Monday that the Texas Alcoholic Beverage Commission “is implementing a Summary Suspension closing Twin Peaks for at least 7 days. This is not a punitive action on TABC’s part but done due to the ongoing danger it presents to our community.”

CBS affiliate KWTX reported that the Twin Peaks corporate office canceled the Waco store’s franchise agreement on Monday.

“We are in the people business and the safety of the employees and guests in our restaurants is priority one,” the company said in a statement, according to KWTX. “Unfortunately the management team of the franchised restaurant in Waco chose to ignore the warnings and advice from both the police and our company, and did not uphold the high security standards we have in place to ensure everyone is safe at our restaurants.

“We will not tolerate the actions of this relatively new franchisee and are revoking their franchise agreement immediately. Our sympathies continue to be with the families of those who died and are very thankful no employees, guests, police officers or bystanders were hurt or injured.”

A witness who had just finished lunch at a nearby restaurant told KWTX that he and his family walked into the parking lot when they heard multiple gunshots and saw wounded people being removed from the scene.

“We crouched down in front of our pickup truck because that was the only cover we had,” said the man, who asked not to be identified.

Another witness, Michelle Logan, told the Tribune-Herald: “There were maybe 30 guns being fired in the parking lot, maybe 100 rounds. They just opened fire. … There’s a lot of people in the hospital, a lot of people shot.”

Vehicles parked near the restaurant were riddled with bullet holes, the newspaper noted.

Headquartered in Dallas, Twin Peaks is a casual dining chain with dozens of locations nationwide that employs a largely female staff scantily clad in plaid shirts and mini shorts.

“Twin Peaks Girls,” the company advertises, offer customers “signature ‘Girl Next Door’ charisma and playful personalities.”

The Waco location opened in August and was touted by a company spokesman as offering 24 types of beer and 55 flatscreen TVs, as well as “Bike Night” on Thursdays.

“Get revved up and ready to go at Twin Peaks bike night,” a calendar on the Twin Peaks Waco Web site advertised.

Holley, du Lac and Berman reported from Washington. Madigan reported from Waco.

[This post, originally published on May 17, has been updated multiple times.]
column4:
Police say 170 arrested in deadly biker gang shootout at Texas restaurant Police in Waco, Tex., said Monday they had arrested 170 people after a shootout involving multiple biker gangs at a restaurant that left at least nine people dead.

While investigators worked to piece together precisely what happened on Sunday, authorities said they remained alert after receiving threats of possible retaliation against police officers after the chaotic brawl.

The sea of people arrested were charged with engaging in organized criminal activity, which is a capital murder charge due to the number of victims, Sgt. W. Patrick Swanton, a Waco police spokesman, said at a news conference Monday.

“There was a significant danger here yesterday because of the amount of violence that occurred behind us here,” Swanton said while standing in front of the restaurant.

The spasm of deadly violence began when members of biker gangs began fighting inside the restroom of Twin Peaks, a restaurant in a retail strip on Interstate 35 known to locals as a biker bar. In addition to firearms, the fighting involved fists, feet, knives and chains, officials said.

Swanton said that gunfire began inside the restaurant before spilled out onto the patio bar area and then into the parking lot. Several shooting victims were found near the front of the restaurant or in the parking lot around it, he said.

“We had wounded inside, we had people stabbed, we had people shot and we had people beat,” Swanton said.

There were already 18 police officers and another four officers from the state Department of Public Safety in the parking lot because officials had received information about the danger posed by these gangs being in the same place, Swanton said. Once outside, the bikers turned their gunfire on the police officers who responded, he said.

“Those officers’ reactions…to a very hostile, deadly situation saved our citizens’ lives yesterday afternoon,” Swanton said.

After the fighting, authorities said that nine people had been killed, and remarkably no police officers or other bystanders in the area had been injured.

The 170 people taken into custody were initially taken to the city’s convention center for processing before being brought to the McLennan County Jail, which was still working to process all of these individuals on Monday.

Police originally said 192 people were arrested, but Swanton revised that number on Monday and said it was possible the number could still change as they continued to sift through all of the names.

The jail, located about 15 minutes away from the retail strip where the shootings occurred, was still working Monday morning to process all of the people who had been arrested, an official said.

Authorities continued to investigate the area around the Twin Peaks restaurant on Monday. More than 100 motorcycles and dozens of other vehicles remained in the parking lot.

“We’re not in a rush,” Swanton said. “This is obviously a very large investigation involving numerous agencies and organizations, and we’re going to get it right.”

[Police: Restaurant has some answering to do]

Swanton said police have received information about “payback” against officers and reports of bikers flooding into the area after the shooting. As a result, he said officers have been stationed around the region to watch for any threat.

“There was a green light put out on law enforcement is our understanding from last night,” he said Monday. “We’re aware of that threat, and we have the appropriate response if we have to face that.”

The brawl occurred on Sunday at noon at the sports bar, with violence erupting and sending terrified patrons diving for cover in a busy Central Texas shopping center.

Swanton was critical of the restaurant, saying after the shootout that its management has “not been of much assistance to us.”

It was typical to see motorcycles parked outside of Twin Peaks, said Saul Cornejo Bravo, 19, a server at a Mexican restaurant next door.

“But not that many, especially on a Sunday afternoon,” he said. “Usually I see them there later at night.”

Bravo said that he was working on Sunday when the shooting occurred, and within seconds he saw emergency vehicles flooding the parking lot.

He saw one man wearing a biker’s vest who appeared to have been shot in the stomach. Paramedics tried to perform CPR for several minutes, Bravo said. “Then they just covered him up,” he said.

Off-duty police officers shopping in the retail strip rushed to the scene despite lacking any protective gear, Swanton said. Meanwhile, some of the people who ran away from Twin Peaks as the chaos unfolded took shelter behind an empty building.

“We sat there gathering our wits,” said J.R., who works at Cabela’s Outpost, an outdoors store across the parking lot from Twin Peaks. “At first you think it’s like a carjacking or something. But then, with all the shots and people running you realize it’s something more serious.”

Police said in a statement Monday said the Twin Peaks restaurant and parking lot were “still a very active crime scene” — one that “is littered with bullets, blood and other evidence. Civilian as well as Police units with bullet holes remain to be processed.” Parts of Central Texas Market Place, where the Twin Peaks sports bar is located, were expected to remain closed for the day, police said.

Five known gangs were believed to be involved in the brawl, Swanton said, but he would not identify them on Monday.

“I am not about to give them the respect of mentioning their names…. We don’t care what their names are, and we’re not going to give them publicity,” he said.

Swanton said it was still not clear how many shots were fired by gang members or police. It was unclear whether any of the nine bikers killed in the fight were shot by police.

“It was chaos,” said J.R., who declined to give his last name. “People were screaming and going crazy. Most of it seemed to be in the parking lot, and it was over very quickly.”

All of the people charged with organized crime activity will face a capital murder charge, Swanton said, due to the number of people killed Sunday. Texas state law says that a person who murders more than one other person “during the same criminal transaction” can face this charge, while  suspects can be charged with organized criminal activity if they carry out a murder or capital murder as part of a criminal street gang.

Eighteen people were taken to hospitals after the brawl with injuries that included stab and gunshot wounds, Swanton said. Some victims were being treated for both, he told reporters in Central Texas on Sunday.

McLennan County Sheriff Parnell McNamara said all nine who were killed were members of the Bandidos or Cossacks gangs, according to the AP.

A threat assessment released last year by the Texas Department of Public Safety classified the Bandidos gang in the second-highest tier threat. The Department of Justice lists the Bandidos as one of the handful of organized motorcycle gangs that “pose a serious national domestic threat.”

[How the Bandidos became one of the world’s most feared biker gangs]

For some in the region, they could sense rising friction between the different motorcycle gangs when members were at the same bars and restaurants.

“There were these little tiffs going on, and then you add alcohol,” said Richard, a motorcycle enthusiast who also declined to give his last name. “I just felt like there was tension.”

“Ninety nine percent of of the people who ride bikes are good people, doctors, lawyer, engineers,” said Richard, an engineer. “It’s the one percent that don’t care about anything. They say, ‘We’ll do what we do.’ It was a rude awakening for the rest of us. Is this going to land on our doorsteps? Is this what we have to look forward to? What happens if we’re wearing the wrong shirt in the wrong neighborhood? That’s what has a lot of us worried.”

On Sunday, witnesses described seeing a mass shootout that involved dozens of of guns being fired inside the restaurant and in the parking lot along Interstate 35, according to CBS affiliate KWTX. The station reported that panicked patrons and employees sought refuge from the mayhem in the restaurant freezer.

Hours later, authorities from multiple law enforcement agencies — including local and state police, and the federal Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives — were still trying to secure the area and survey the large crime scene, which was littered with more than 100 weapons.

The officers returned fire, Swanton said, and some armed bikers were shot by police. Swanton defended the officers’ actions and said they prevented more deaths.

“Their action has saved lives in keeping this from spilling into a very busy Sunday morning,” he said, according to CNN. “Thank goodness the officers were here, and took the action that they needed to take to save numerous lives.”

We share in the community’s trauma. Our priority is to provide a safe and enjoyable environment for our customers and employees, and we consider the police our partners in doing so.”

Patel added that “our management team has had ongoing and positive communications with the police and … we will continue to cooperate with the police as they investigate this terrible crime.”

Swanton called Patel’s statement a “fabrication,” according to the AP, which reported that the Waco police “described the management as uncooperative with authorities in addressing concerns about the gangs.”

column2: You really expect me to believe that? Hillary Clinton, Barack Obama and our liberal media
column3:
Reporter: Mr. President, when did you first learn that Hillary Clinton used an email system outside the U.S. government for official business when she was Secretary of State?

POTUS: The same time as everybody else, through news reports.

On Sunday, President Obama insisted he knew nothing about Hillary Clinton and her use of a separate server to send email while serving as his secretary of state for four years, and learned about it through news reports along with the rest of us. How many times have we seen this movie? How many times has this administration been confronted with a scandal only to have the president or his spokesmen make this statement with straight faces?

It makes you wonder: What goes on behind the scenes that results in these whoppers? Since this administration lives in a fantasy land, let's imagine scenes of our own:

RG: Mr. President, we're so very sorry to interrupt your game --

POTUS, staring at VPOTUS, irritated: Why are you here?

RG: Sir, it looks like that Air Force One photo-op over Manhattan almost caused a massive panic. We need a response from you.

POTUS: Joe, can't you handle this?

VPOTUS: It's your plane, sir. Mine was flying over Pittsburgh and no one noticed.

RG: We have your talking points, sir. Just tell the press, "It was a mistake. It was something we found out about along with all of you."

POTUS: Fine. Now get lost, both of you.

That scenario may be fictional -- but those were, in fact, the very words Obama used.

March 22, 2011, 11:15 AM. Oval Office. WH Press Secretary Jay Carney and Biden enter. Obama is yawning.

JC: Sir, we have a situation. The Republicans have learned about Fast and Furious killing that agent. CNN wants to know how much you knew.

POTUS: Big deal. I'll tell 'em -- how's this -- "I heard on the news about this Fast and Furious story where allegedly" -- (laughs) get that? -- "guns were being run into Mexico." What the hell. I'll also say "the Attorney General has been very clear he knew nothing about this."  Holder will owe me one. Where's Biden with my coffee?

Those were the very phrases Obama uttered that day.

JC: The cat's out of the bag, Mr. President. They know about the IRS going after those

Tea Party nuts. You have to say something during your presser with Cameron today.

Later that day, at White House press conference with British PM David Cameron.

POTUS: Well let me take the IRS situation first. I first learned about it from the same news reports that I think most people learned about this. I think it was on Friday.

JC: Another problem, sir. DOJ subpoenaed the AP to get those phone records. The press ain't happy about this.

POTUS: Can't you see I'm busy? You take care of it. (Looking irritated at Biden) Shouldn't you be at a funeral?

JZ: Come on, man, shoot! Ain't got all day.

Later that day at the White House Press Briefing:

Reporter: When did the president find out about the Department of Justice subpoenas for the Associated Press?

JC:  Yesterday. We found out about the news reports yesterday on the road.

VPOTUS: Jay, we've got a situation. They know about those fraudulent VA reports. This one's big! What should we do?

JC: (sigh) I'll take care of it. Get me a Starbucks.

Reporter: The delays have been known for some time, but the fraudulent --

JC: If you mean the specific allegations that I think we're reported first by your network, I believe we learned about them through the reports.

It is simply inconceivable -- no, unbelievable -- that the press knows more about the scandals surrounding this administration than does the administration.

It begs the question: So why do the media put up with this nonsense? They know that they're being played for fools and yet they go along with it, time and again. Their loyalty to Barack Obama is that strong.

Why does this administration constantly lie? Because they can.

L. Brent Bozell III is founder and president of the Media Research Center.

column13: my friends are immigrants with the exception of one or two Americans
column14: and even with those American friends I feel like they don’t understand because they still have a blind over their eyes and believe that their country is wonderful. piccadillybabe

column12: every single person I ran into there seemed… happy. And you could feel it too. I have also been to lima peru
column16: and some places in the middle east. Anyways
column18: same deal(with the exception of the middle east) you could feel the attitude there
column19: festive and fun. The feeling I get in the states is disconnected and cold. People don’t want to socialize with each other here. Maybe it’s because of technology overload. People don’t get out of their cars and walk anymore. There’s no street vendors or anything either… It feels dead here. >_> Mudpie

column12: energetic leaders to encourage us with communication…speak to us as a nation
column13: revitalize us with their spirit and leadership. A leadership which calls on those in the country to take us down the right paths to renew the economy and rebuild the nation. Jackie Milton

column36:
man dangerous political operative america it’s near midnight steve bannon push past bluegrass band living room crowd republican congressman political operative stray duck dynasty cast member he’s try make way back siriusxm patriot radio show broadcast live cramp corner townhouse occupy stone’s throw supreme court it’s late february annual conservative political action conference full swing bannon usual whirlwind center action.

bannon executive chairman breitbart news crusade right-wing populist website that’s lineal descendant drudge report late founder andrew breitbart spent year apprentice matt drudge people think fox news polite restrain he’d spent day cpac among conservative faithful zip back forth siriusxm booth unlikely pair guest squire around nigel farage leader britain’s right-wing ukip party phil robertson bandanna’d ayatollah-bearded duck dynasty patriarch accept free-speech award cpac beauty contest republican presidential hopeful robertson novelty adornment invite a&e suspend denouncing gay deliver wild rant “beatniks” sexually transmit disease upstaged bannon’s evident delight “if there’s explosion fire somewhere,” say matthew boyle breitbart’s washington political editor “steve’s probably nearby matches.” afterward everyone pile party bus head townhouse.

bannon ex-goldman sachs banker sort character would stand anywhere especially drab environs washington mile-a-minute talker thrum energy sentence speed ahead spin great pileup nouns verbs grin swept-back blond hair partiality cargo short flip-flops look like jeff spicoli decade hard live employ “dude” readily.

ordinarily bannon’s townhouse crypt-quiet feel like museum it’s faithfully decorate embroidered silk curtain paint mural authentic lincoln-era detail first stop january sign hadn’t teleport back picture mantle smile woman throne machine gun lap bannon’s daughter maureen west point grad lieutenant airborne division throne belong saddam hussein—or bannon show sound heard faint noise basement might young woman call valkyrie war goddess norse mythology decide soldiers’ fate battle later.

on february night however party roar along cpac triumph secret project he’d conceive nearing fruition lawyer almost finish vet book bill hillary clinton’s murky financial dealing he’s certain upend presidential race “dude it’s go epic,” tell sip “moonshine”—his wink dynasty guests—and wonder people often whether bannon nut way doorman hand gift silver hip flask “breitbart” print image honey badger insouciant african predator youtube fame whose catchphrase “honey badger don’t give s---,” breitbart motto.

bannon’s life succession gatsbyish reinventions make rich land squarely middle presidential race he’s naval officer investment banker minor hollywood player political impresario former disney chief michael ovitz’s empire fall piece bannon sit ovitz living room deliver news finish sarah palin height fame bannon whisper ear donald trump decide blow republican presidential field bannon encourage circus-like visit u.s.-mexico border john boehner quit house speaker mutinous frenzy bannon confederate whip among conservative today back mysterious investor stream seinfeld royalty sit nexus hillary clinton dub “the vast right-wing conspiracy,” network do anyone else complicate presidential ambitions—and plan “conspiracy,” least bannon mutate something different clinton describe it’s eager go establishment republican boehner jeb bush democrat like clinton.

“i come blue-collar irish catholic pro-kennedy pro-union family democrats,” say bannon way explain politics “i wasn’t political get service saw badly jimmy carter f---ed thing become huge reagan admirer still turn whole establishment come back run company asia see bush f---ed badly carter whole country disaster.”

as befits someone peripatetic background bannon kind jekyll-and-hyde figure complicate ecosystem right—he's two thing he’s devise method influence politics marries old-style attack journalism breitbart.com help drive boehner sophisticated approach conduct nonprofit government accountability institute build rigorous fact-based indictment major politician partner mainstream medium outlet conservative typically despise disseminate finding broad audience big product system project bannon excite cpac bestselling investigative book write gai’s president peter schweizer clinton cash untold story foreign government business help make bill hillary rich publish may harpercollins book dominate political landscape week probably shape public perception hillary clinton barb republican detractors.

jeb bush come treatment oct gai publish schweizer’s e-book bush buck public service corporation help make jeb rich examine bush enrich leave florida governor’s mansion copy obtain bloomberg businessweek examines bush’s florida land deal corporate board sinecures seven-figure salary lehman brother whose bankruptcy touch financial crisis “it’s cinematic clinton warlord russian gangster whole cast bad guys,” say bannon “bush prosaic it’s really grimy low-energy crony capitalism.”

while attack favor candidate party may seem odd bannon say he’s motivate populist disgust washington that’s animate candidate trump bernie sander like bannon big influence anyone could reasonably expect year outsider perhaps fitting figure like bannon nobody saw come would roil national political debate.

most day bannon find hyde persona washington office breitbart news operating basement townhouse—known breitbart embassy—breitbart’s pirate crew become tribune rise tea party movement barack obama’s election bedevil gop leader help foment government shutdown site also make life hell democrats example orchestrate career-ending genital tweet misfortune cost new york representative anthony weiner seat congress tip weiner’s proclivity sexting female admirer bannon say site pay tracker follow twitter account hour day eventually intercept crotch shot weiner inadvertently make public ensue scandal culminate surreal scene carry live television andrew breitbart hijack weiner’s press conference field question astonish reporters.

on occasion partisan zeal lead egregious error lunch january breitbart reporter publish article assail obama’s nominee attorney general loretta lynch—but go wrong woman wasn’t site report loretta lynch part bill clinton’s defense team embarrass reporter ask time bannon allergic hint concession refuse “i tell ‘no fact you’re go write story every day week.’ ” shrugs “we’re honey badgers,” explain “we don’t give s---.”

but bannon realize politics sometimes effective it’s subtle he’s nurture dr jekyll side become founding chairman gai nonpartisan research organization staff lawyer data scientist forensic investigator “what peter notice it’s fact rumor resonate best investigative reporters,” bannon say refer gai’s president establish tallahassee study crony capitalism governmental malfeasance gai collaborate mainstream news outlet newsweek abc news cbs’s story range insider trading congress credit card fraud among presidential campaign essentially mine operation political scoop churn book like clinton cash bush bucks.

what make clinton cash unexpectedly influential mainstream news reporter pick often advanced schweizer’s many example clintons’ apparent conflict interest accept money large donor foreign government “practically grotesque,” write harvard law school professor lawrence lessig who’s run democratic presidential nomination “on fair reading pattern behavior schweizer charge corruption.” book’s release new york time run front-page story canadian mining magnate frank giustra give ten million dollar clinton foundation fly bill clinton kazakhstan aboard private jet dine country’s autocratic president nursultan nazarbayev giustra subsequently lucrative uranium-mining right country giustra denies clinton dinner influence kazakh mining decision time piece cite schweizer’s still-unpublished book source report puzzle many time reader prompt reaction paper’s ombudswoman margaret sullivan grudgingly conclude ethical standard breach “i still don’t like way looked.”

for bannon clinton cash uproar validate personal theory inform goldman sachs experience conservative influence medium fail last time clinton run white house “in tell “conservative medium couldn’t take bill clinton produce punditry opinion always oversold conclusion ‘it’s clearly impeachable!’ wound talk echo chamber.” news conservative produce david brock’s troopergate investigation paula jones american spectator often taint eye mainstream editor explicit partisan association.

in response bannon develop two related insight “one thing goldman teach don’t first guy door you’re go get arrow it’s junk bond let michael milken lead way,” say “goldman would never lead product find business partner.” insight reporter staff investigative unit major newspaper aren’t liberal ideologue conservative fever dream kindred soul could recruit large enterprise “what realize hang investigative reporter may personally liberal don’t let get way good story,” say “and bring real story build fact they’re f---ing badasses they’re fair.” recently meet brock renounce conservatism become important liberal strategist fundraiser clinton ally found liberal watchdog group medium matter america publish book kill messenger right-wing plot derail hillary hijack government brock’s attitude toward bannon isn’t enmity toward ideological opponent i'd expect rather curiosity professional respect tradecraft bannon demonstrate advance clinton cash narrative conservative learn brock say “your operation isn’t go succeed don’t cross barrier mainstream.” back say conservative report undergo elaborate laundering influence u.s politics reporter brock would publish small magazine website try get story plant british tabloid hope right-leaning u.s outlet new york post drudge report pick generate enough heat might break mainstream paper.

“from point view time perfect host body virus”

“it seem me,” say brock bannon team “what able deal time strategy sophisticate potentially effective damaging reputation time try create doubt qualm hillary clinton among progressive time place it.” pause “looking point view time perfect host body virus.”

it wasn’t one june clinton cash frenzy hit apex bannon say “we’ve get best investigative reporter best newspaper country chase hillary clinton.” there’s come bannon reveals include graphic novel clinton cash january clinton cash movie set arrive february presidential primary voting get way.

in right-wing activist enjoy long period ascendancy collapse prime target clinton great ally house republican halt uprising sheer lunacy perpetrator classic example house oversight chairman dan burton indiana become convinced suicide white house deputy counsel vince foster actually murder—a theory seek prove reenact crime backyard pistol watermelon democrat seize episode impugn credibility brand “watermelon dan.” “we use watermelon phantom vince foster sighting say chris lehane clinton white house staffer field marshal partisan war phrase didn’t exist that’s right-wing conspiracy jump shark.”

bannon believe episode like kill conservatives’ credibility political influence he’s set balance conservatives’ wilder impulses professionalism run theme life bear working-class family within sight naval base norfolk va sign straight college spend four year sea aboard destroyer first auxiliary engineer pacific navigator north arabian sea iranian hostage crisis time arrive persian gulf u.s prepare ill-fated assault tehran bannon’s faith commander chief dim “you could tell go goat f---.” battle group rotate carter’s desert one debacle.

bannon become special assistant chief naval operation pentagon earn master’s degree national security study georgetown university night restless siren reagan-era wall street capitalism drain military life luster resolve make leap “somebody tell me,” say “if want go wall street go harvard business school.” hb accept bannon matriculate harvard stint coincide wall street’s boom fuel fantasy among classmate full-on debauch investment-banker lifestyle bannon become grind make first-year honor blanket top firm application summer associateship universally reject classmate tell age navy background obstacles—he hadn’t come right schools.

one day goldman sachs representative invite bannon campus recruit party thinking could talk job donned suit head “i get there’s like people jam tent,” say “i say ‘f there’s chance.’ stand side drink two schmendricks stand next talk guy great conversation baseball find half hour john weinberg jr whose dad run firm guy name rob kaplan become senior partner.” night goldman executive gather discuss prospective hire one later recount scene “they say ‘well bannon guess we’re gonna reject he’s old summer job,’ ” bannon say “and guy say ‘oh talk he’s terrific.’ literally complete crapshoot get job.”

bannon land goldman’s new york office height hostile takeover boom “everything midwest raid milken,” say “it like firestorm.” goldman didn’t hostile takeover instead specialize raid defense company target like drexel burnham first boston first year work every day except christmas love “the camaraderie amaze like navy wardroom ship.” later work series leverage buyout include deal calumet coach involve bain capital up-and-comer name mitt romney.

two big thing go goldman sachs late globalization world capital market mean size suddenly matter everyone realize firm private partnership would go public banker also could see glass-steagall act separate commercial investment banking go fall set flurry acquisition specialist would command premium bannon ship los angeles specialize medium entertainment “a lot people come outside buying medium companies,” say “there huge consolidation.”

after year bannon couple goldman colleague set launch bannon co boutique investment bank specialize medium time investor prefer hard assets—manufacturing company real estate—and avoid thing like movie studio film library hard price bannon’s group draw data vhs cassette sale tv rating devise model value intellectual property way tangible asset “we get ton business,” says.

when french bank crédit lyonnais major financier independent hollywood studio almost go bankrupt bannon co roll loan portfolio mgm go bust work studio’s financing polygram record get film business bannon’s firm handle acquisitions.

and serendipitously bannon wound entertainment business westinghouse electric client look unload castle rock entertainment big tv movie presence include billy crystal’s film bannon reel eager buyer ted turner “turner go build huge studio,” say “so negotiate deal st regis hotel new york often happen turner come time actually close deal ted short cash westinghouse want tell ‘you ought take deal it’s great deal.’ go ‘if great deal don’t defer cash fee keep ownership stake package tv rights?’ ” lieu full adviser’s fee firm accept stake five show include one third season regard runt litter seinfeld “we calculate would get u make syndication,” say bannon “we wrong factor five.”

after société générale buy bannon co bannon longer needing day job dive hollywood moguldom become executive producer movie include anthony hopkins’s oscar-nominated titus meet hard-partying talent manager name jeff kwatinetz discover band korn manage backstreet boy bannon sell company kwatinetz launch one management outfit call firm whose client include ice cube martin lawrence newly flush sense adventure bannon become partner key player firm’s great coup acquisition former disney chief ovitz’s company artists management group ovitz spend million build medium giant think would conquer hollywood amg bleed money sell firm last-ditch bid save face instead vanity fair recount bannon dispatch ovitz’s beverly hill mansion deliver final humiliation person offer amg million less value ovitz’s home.

the hollywood ether soon convinced bannon passion wasn’t financing film make sour wall street come represent “goldman like priesthood monastic experience work time incredibly dedicate client service build grow companies,” say underwent conversion like one michael lewis describe watch horror staid private partnership goldman sachs become highly leveraged publicly trade company operate like casino “i turn wall street reason everybody else american taxpayer force cut mook deal bail guy didn’t deserve it.”

bannon’s political awakening also spur sept attack lead make reagan-venerating documentary face evil “a brilliant effort … extremely well done,” say rush limbaugh introduce schweizer cold war scholar whose book reagan’s war basis film also bring andrew breitbart’s orbit “we screen film festival beverly hills,” bannon recall “and crowd come like bear who’s squeeze like head’s go blow say we’ve gotta take back culture.”

his film pepper footage lion attack helpless gazelle seedling burst ground glorious bloom

breitbart also live los angeles profound influence bannon meet breitbart start website work drudge help arianna huffington launch huffington post bannon lent financial acumen office space marvel breitbart’s visceral feel news cycle ability shape coverage drudge report avidly follow tv producer news editors.

“one thing admire dirty word ‘punditry,’ ” say bannon “our vision—andrew’s vision—was always build global center-right populist anti-establishment news site.” mind set line investors.

bannon continue make documentaries—big crashing opinionated films wagner score arrest imagery battle america celebrate tea party generation zero examine root financial meltdown undefeated champion palin bannon repertoire metaphor direct film pepper footage lion attack helpless gazelle seedling burst ground glorious bloom palin one ate travel iowa trail hundred reporter appear screen pella press think might signal entrance presidential race luck breitbart come along promoter ringmaster speak afterward describe bannon sincere admiration leni riefenstahl tea party movement.

in breitbart news hit wall site publish video furnish conservative activist speech naacp department agriculture official name shirley sherrod appear advocate anti-white racism within hour fire story blanket cable news soon become clear breitbart news video misleadingly edited—that sherrod’s point opposite portray fox news aggressively promote video ban andrew breitbart on-air guest bannon raise capital site’s relaunch suddenly encounter “nuclear winter.”

but gauge medium standard shift since ostracization breitbart news didn’t last long less year later site catch weiner tweet picture genitals andrew breitbart welcome back fox news experience teach bannon power real news.

on morning march relaunch day away andrew breitbart walk brentwood neighborhood collapse died soon heart failure bannon get news new york pitching investor funeral drudge ask bannon plan “we’re go ahead launch,” replied bannon step executive chairman.

breitbart’s genius grasp good anyone else early century press baron understood—that reader don’t approach news clinical exercise absorb fact experience viscerally ongoing drama distinct story line hero villain breitbart excel create narrative editorial approach that's live “when editorial call don’t even bring anything feel like one-off story even it’d best story site,” say alex marlow site’s editor chief “our whole mindset look roll narratives.” rattle popular one breitbart news cover intensively posture aggrieve persecution “the big one won’t surprise you,” say “immigration isi race riot call ‘the collapse traditional values.’ i’d say hillary clinton tops.”
